title: CN Level 6 â€” Application Layer Protocols
concept: HTTP, HTTPS, DNS, email protocols (SMTP, POP3, IMAP) and basic behavior.

challenges.question: DNS (Domain Name System) is used to:

options.B: Map domain names to IP addresses
options.D: Compress image files on the web

challenges.explanation: DNS resolves human-readable names (like example.com) to IP addresses.

challenges.question: HTTP is primarily a:
challenges.explanation: HTTP is an Application-layer protocol built on top of TCP.

challenges.question: HTTPS is essentially:

options.B: HTTP using UDP instead of TCP
options.D: A protocol for sending emails only

challenges.explanation: HTTPS wraps HTTP inside an encrypted SSL/TLS tunnel for secure communication.

challenges.question: Which protocol is most commonly used to send emails from a client to a mail server?
challenges.explanation: SMTP (Simple Mail Transfer Protocol) is used for sending mail between clients and servers and between servers.

challenges.question: Which protocol is commonly used by a mail client to retrieve emails while keeping them stored on the server (synchronization across devices)?
challenges.explanation: IMAP keeps mail on the server and synchronizes state across multiple clients.
